What is the diference between roguelite and roguelike?

Roguelike and roguelite are both terms used to describe a type of game that shares similarities with the classic roguelike genre, but with some key differences. 
The main difference between roguelike and roguelite is the permadeath aspect. In roguelike games, the player's character dies and loses all progress upon death, whereas roguelite games have a permanent death state, but allow the player to keep their progress. Additionally, roguelike games typically have a larger focus on procedurally generated dungeons and enemies, while roguelite games often have more hand-designed levels and enemies. Finally, roguelike games often have a more complex and challenging gameplay experience, while roguelite games are typically more casual and user-friendly.
